metadata.titel_preek: Laodicea, Part V: A Promise After A Welcome

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human individual must decide to open the door of their heart to Christ to achieve personal adequacy, security, and victory over societal ills.

tekstueel_bewijs: the choice for God is completely in your hands. Not his, yours.
If your destination is to be heaven... it is in your hands and mine, not God's.
The door of the human heart opens only from the inside.
security is at the end of it all.

zender.identificatie: The Preacher / Moral Law of Choice
tekstueel_bewijs: I would to God as I call to you... remember this
Christ the Lord can really make you feel right about yourself.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies strongly as the Subject who must act.

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ alone can build you up, strengthen you
he is a compass by which you can steer safely
helper.rol_van_god: God is an instrumental Helper/Resource for the human Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help/strengthening of the human will.

tegenstander.identificatie: Societal Ills (Drugs, Racism, Money-mindedness) and Personal Inadequacy
tekstueel_bewijs: In a world where crack is and where suicide is
because they feel inadequate. They can't cope.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as external social pressures or internal psychological feelings rather than cosmic Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The cosmic victory of Christ is used as a motivational backdrop to encourage the individual's primary program of 'opening the door'.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: you are the master of your fate
The choice... is in your hands.

voorbeelden: you ought to have all of those things
the choice for God is completely in your hands
If you want to bring your life to triumph
How will you tell where you are?
The door... opens only from the inside.
That's as far as he can go.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the human will (Vouloir) and the inherent power (Pouvoir) of the individual to initiate the relationship.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Social ills) to ~S2 (The act of opening) to S1 (Feeling right about oneself).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by human volition; Christ is the 'fixed point' that enables the movement.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a psychological/social problem rather than a spiritual condition of 'deadness'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language, the actantial 'engine' is anthropocentric. The power to initiate salvation and the responsibility for the 'destination' are placed entirely in the human Subject.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If heaven is to be your home, it is in your hands and mine, not God's.
Christ the Lord can really make you feel right about yourself.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ is going to win. His cause is going to overcome.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Christ's earthly life is used as a model of 'needing' others, which is then used to argue that God 'needs' the hearer.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jesus (as one who needs a boat/stable)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God does not need the boat; God provides the boat to reach the people. The focus should be on God's condescension, not His lack.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'opening' and anxiety regarding the 'choice'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagianism; the human will is the primary mover in the soteriological event.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: There is a clash between the 'God has decreed victory' ending and the 'It is in your hands, not God's' beginning.
spanning_punten: If God has decreed the victory, how can it be 'not in His hands'?

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ alone can... put a spring in your step and courage in your heart.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer already has the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) to open the door.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'illness' or 'inadequacy' rather than rebellion or spiritual death.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (in the individual sense) and God (in the cosmic sense).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a motivational speech where Christ is a resource for the human ego to overcome social obstacles.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of the door-opening.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ is the one who breaks down the door or gives the dead heart the power to respond.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'The choice is in your hands,' use 'Christ has come to claim you, and His knock is the power that opens your heart.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' of a gift they cannot produce.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'Receiver' actant in the Axis of Transmission.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on Pouvoir (Grace as the endowment of power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Preach on how Christ gives the 'wanting' and the 'doing'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the Opponent as the 'Total Inability' of the heart to open itself.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'feeling low', the solution is just 'feeling high' (therapeutic).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (overcoming) is fused with Soteriology (opening the door).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ opens the door (Soteriology). 2. We sup with Him (Communion). 3. We overcome the world (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The preacher has a powerful rhetorical style, but the structural foundation is dangerously anthropocentric. Reclaiming God's agency will turn this from a burden into Good News.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is moving and uses vivid imagery (Holman Hunt). Actantially, it reveals a Pelagian core.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Rev 3:20 often ignores that it is addressed to the church; the actantial analysis shows the preacher uses this to create a secondary 'recruitment' program.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that Christ is relegated to the 'Helper' role, while the human 'Subject' holds the 'Object' of salvation.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly denies God's sovereignty in the act of conversion ('not his, yours').
